Text: Re Asset Divestiture Approval Cc Legal is reviewing the contract at this time and hopes to finish next week Yesterday I was notified that the guaranteed revenues from the transportation agreement may be raised by to due to revised sizing requirements of the TBS as requested by NSP We have had several meetings with operations to ensure that the facilities that are included in the sale are correct Also the OM savings are the estimates given by the field Based on average costs for similar facilities the expected OM savings would be between K and k The field has indicated however because of the encroachment that they receive a large number of line locate requests each year for these branchlines which drives up the OM costs My expectations are that we would save closer to k in OM costs rather than the k In addition regulatory reminded me today that there is still a farm tap issue that has to be cleared up before the sale All farm taps receiving service from these branchlines must be disconnected and service provided by another utility prior to the sale The latest estimate that I received was that this would be completed by the end of the year David

NorthfieldFaribault Asset Divestiture Cc the details of the proposed sale of the Northfield and Faribault branch lines The associated contracts are also attached for your review File Edoc is the actual purchase sale agreement and file Ddoc identifies the assets to be sold Please review and let me know if you have any concerns or questions If you would like I can set up a meeting with Bob Stevens who is the marketer for this deal to discuss further Forwarded by Dave WaymireETSEnron on AM Dave Waymire PM To Danny McCartyET nron Dave NeubauerET NRON Rod NRON Michel NelsonET NRON Mike McGowanET NRON Mary Kay MillerET NRON Steven HarrisET NRON Julia WhiteET NRON Drew FossumET NRON cc James CentilliET NRON Bob StevensET nron Subject Asset Divestiture Approval Attached is a Asset Divestiture Approval Form for the sale of the Faribault Minnesota branchline location consisting of miles of pipe and the Faribault TBS and the Northfield branchlines location Nos and consisting of approximately miles of pipe and the Northfield TBS Please indicate your approval or rejection of this proposal on the approval form and return to either James Centilli EB or David Waymire OMA by PM Monday November th If you have questions or concerns please contact James Centilli or myself These branchlines are experiencing heavy encroachment The Faribault branchline is currently being odorized by NSP per a previous arrangement in order to comply with a commitment NNG made to the DOT to transport odorized gas because of the population density along the pipeline There is no threat of a by pass by selling these branchlines There is an estimated annual OM savings of k to k plus the avoided expense exposure and operational headaches of not having to monitor high pressure branchline odorization The net book value of these facilities is The facilities will be sold for In addition NSP has agreed to enter into a year transportation agreement guaranteeing incremental revenues of The net book value of the facilities is assumed to be of such small value as to be de minimus as allowed by previous rulings of the Commission and will be treated as a nonoperating unit This will allow the undepreciated balance to be cleared to depreciation reserves The sale will require that the Northfield TBS be relocated upstream of the main line take off at an estimated cost of David

Re Northfield Faribault Asset Divestiture Approval Form Cc The asset divestiture procedure requires approval from all officers before marketingfield services begin negotiations with potential buyers Danny McCarty has sent me an email indicating his approval David
